problems.title: Repeated DNA Sequences (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

The DNA sequence is composed of a series of nucleotides abbreviated as 'A', 'C', 'G', and 'T'.
For example, "ACGAATTCCG" is a DNA sequence.
When studying DNA, it is useful to identify repeated sequences within the DNA.
Given a string s that represents a DNA sequence, return all the 10-letter-long sequences (substrings) that occur more than once in a DNA molecule. You may return the answer in any order.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
AAAAACCCCCAAAAACCCCCCAAAAAGGGTTT

Sample Output
AAAAACCCCC CCCCCAAAAA

Explanation: The 10-letter sequences that occur more than once are shown.

Sample Input
AAAAAAAAAAAAA

Sample Output
AAAAAAAAAA

Explanation: The 10-letter sequence "AAAAAAAAAA" occurs multiple times.
hintsList: Use a hash set to track all 10-letter substrings and their occurrences.
Use bit manipulation to encode DNA sequences efficiently.
